subject: Writing
title: How Babies Crack the Code
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Babies Crack the Code usable.

hook.text: A newborn hears a wall of noise. Within two years, they're speaking in sentences. How?

buildup.text: Babies start distinguishing speech sounds from noise within hours of birth â€” their brains are primed for language.

discovery.text: By 8 months, babies can detect word boundaries in continuous speech using statistical patterns.

twist.text: Babies born to any language can hear all human sounds. By 12 months, they've specialized to their own language.

climax.text: No one teaches babies grammar explicitly. They extract rules from patterns â€” like tiny scientists running experiments.

punchline.text: Every toddler is a linguistic genius who doesn't know it.

quiz.question: What happens to a baby's sound perception by 12 months?
options: They specialize to their own language's sounds
They can hear more sounds than before
They lose all ability to distinguish sounds
